fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32448].
  {panel}

Currently, when user try to move pages to another space and if another page exist in the space with an indentical title, the following error will appear.
!sample.png!

This error does not tell the user what the title name nor the location of the duplicate page. Imagine if the user is trying to a parent pages with hundred of child pages and encounter the error above, it would take tremendous amount of effort just to find the duplicate title between the spaces.

In my opinion, the warning should at least inform the title of the pages which are duplicated in the spaces they are trying to move into. This way, the user know which page title they need to change.
fields.summary: A better duplicate page warning when try to move pages between spaces.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32440].
  {panel}

When creating a link to a page within Confluence, there should be a way to use a page property's value from that page as the link text. When the page property's value on that other page changes, the incoming link texts should be changed as well.

Real-Life Example: 

We are using Confluence as a requirements specification tool. Every page represents a requirement. Since the navigation tree becomes a little bit unreadable when the title is too long, we are using a short description of the requirement as the title (e.g. "Send Password Reset Token"). On the page, we are using the "Page Properties Macro" to add some other details to the requirement. One of these properties is a field called "User Story" which describes the requirement in one sentence. (e.g. "As a user, I want to get a password reset token to be able to change my password")

When we are referencing this page/requirement we often have the case that we would like to use the "User Story"-value as the link text since this is more detailed.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32413].
  {panel}

Initial steps:
* Use the Office Connector with Excel documents stored as attachments
* Set the excel file to Review -> Share Workbook.

After doing above steps, following is the scenario of the issue:
If two users have the excel workbook open and user_a makes a change and saves, and user_b makes change and saves.
It results two different versions w/o the merged results. 
(As opposed to user_b's save including user 1's change)

Thanks in advance.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32410].
  {panel}

From a product and development planning perspective, I like the idea of being able to write up changes and tasks in a Confluence page and then being able to automatically create tickets based on the content of this page. Which is broadly what this macros does.

However, in its current state it will only take the text you highlight in one cell and add this as the Summary to the Jira ticket. And if you select to make multiple tickets, it will then generate tickets using the content of the same cell from the rows below. So you now have several tickets of the same type with only the Summary field populated, and if you need to add Description, Component, FixVersion, Epic, etc fields, then that has to be done manually.
So my request is to have the ability to have more fields, included custom fields, added automatically from other columns in the table.

As an example, consider the following example table with 5 columns, 1 header row, and 3 content rows where "h" is the header row, and RC is a cell in a row

| h1 | h2 | h3 | h4| h5|
|R1C1 | R1C2 | R1C3 | R1C4 | R1C5 |
|R2C1 | R2C2 | R2C3 | R2C4 | R2C5 |
|R3C1 | R3C2 | R3C3 | R3C4 | R3C5 | 

With the current version I can highlight R1C1 in the first column and if I select to create multiple tickets I will get three tickets containing Summary "R1C1", "R2C1", and "R3C1" respectively.

What I suggested (just an initial thought on how to implement this), would be to:
1: Allow the user to add additional fields to the form. Imagine I add "Component", "FixVersion", and "Epic"
2: One _option_ could then be specify in the form field "Component" to contain "$h2", "FixVersion" to contain "$h3", and "Epic" to contain "$h5"
3: The macro could then be extended to recognise "$h2" as column header, and then add the corresponding cell value into this field per ticket.
4: I would then have tickets containing:
Ticket 1:
  - Summary: R1C1 
  - Component: R1C2
  - FixVersion: R1C3
  - Epic: R1C5

Ticket 2:
  - Summary: R2C1 
  - Component: R2C2
  - FixVersion: R2C3
  - Epic: R2C5

Ticket 3:
  - Summary: R3C1 
  - Component: R3C2
  - FixVersion: R3C3
  - Epic: R3C5

Hope that clarifies. The above example is obviously down to implementation, however the key is to achieve an outcome that allows me to create a more complete ticket based on content from a Confluence table.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32393].
  {panel}

This would be an improvement to either "Space Attachments" or "Attachments" macro.  

you can configure "Attachments" macro to display attachments by label but only from pages you list - not from the whole space or from all of confluence.  So this does not allow enough flexibility for grout.  For example, if I wanted to on "customers" main page display all attachments labeled "Contract" I would have to specify all individual customer subpages in the macro settings.  If new customer if added later I need to go edit the macro to now also display results from the new customer sub page.  If I could specify either parent page, space, or all of confluence I would not have to go back and edit the macro settings.

In "space attachments" macro you can specify what space you want to display attachments from but you can by default filter them down to a specific label.  You can only show ALL attachments and the user must figure out what the label is we are trying to display files for by either sorting the list or filtering themselves.

So neither solution allows for displaying all files by label for all pages and subpages by specifying parent page, space or all of confluence.

We are on Confluence 5.4 at the moment.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32378].
  {panel}

On this New Feature request [CONF-8576|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8576], there was a plan to have Confluence server able to receive emails, and depending on the email address, archive each email to the appropriate space. However, the decision was to not implement it as of yet.

However, there is a section in {{Confluence Admin console > Configuration > Mail Server}} which allows user to configure a POP Mail Server. As of now, this particular feature here is not entirely usable and might create a misunderstanding on user point of view.

In this case, please assess further the possibility to implement this or perhaps remove it temporarily from this part of Confluence Admin console.

Thank you and regards,
Lazuardi

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32373].
  {panel}

Hi, this is perhaps two things:

- It is annoying not to be able to create links in the Code Macro. Specially to documentation. A clear case is when we want to have links to a library reference manual from the examples, like you get with sphinx or doxygen.

- What we would REALLY want is to have this done automatically. For example, any word (likely functions and/or classes) in the source code that matches a page in the space with that name should be shown as a link to it (eg, function "foo()" should always be shown as a link to the page titled "foo", if it exists).

The problem we are trying to solve here is how to migrate users off sphinx or doxygen offering them something *at least close* to what they have at the moment.
fields.summary: Code Macro: Allow links and provide a way of automatically linking to pages if titles found in the code
Support Fortran in Code Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32371].
  {panel}

I had a major catastrohpe this week when I tried to import a new space from one of the old instances of Confluence that my company uses. We are in the process of merging them all into one. 

The admin of the other instance accidentally gave me the export of the whole install instead of just for that one space.

I had imported a space before so I didn't check as I should have. I imported this file and it replaced our entire instance. 

We managed to restore the backup and did not loose much. But we did have some downtime.

I suggest the following to avoid other admins to make that same mistake:
* have a separate page for importing a single space and one for importing the entire install
* whenever anybody imports a full restore, there should be a warning message about what is about to happen and most likely ask for the password again.

[See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32367]. {panel} *Symptoms:* On the Page Properties Report macro either: *A)* Content is missing: !missing.jpeg! *B)* Columns are duplicated: !duplicated.jpeg! *Cause:* When manually modifying a Page Properties table, a hidden tag (like

or ) might be present in the field text, making fields with same text be treated as different. This also makes impossible to list a column by it's name. See the differences in the Storage Format of: {code:html|title=Project Page 3 } .... .... {code} vs {code:html|title=Project Page 1}

Priority

Status
.... ... {code} *So:* * in A) there is a Column Filter applied (Status, Priority) but the Report doesn't find those Columns in "Project Page 3 " because those fields have other characters in it. * in B) the columns are listed separately because although they look the same, they are different to the Report macro. *Expected:* * Special tags to be ignored. If rows look the same, to be treated like the same. *Steps to reproduce:* To get the

or values in the table you have to: # Write two lines of text anywhere on the page # Copy the lines inside the table Editing the field names from now on, will keep the

or value on them. *Workaround:* * Remove the table's row and create it again, for every row with the problem.

Priority
Status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32350].
  {panel}

A feature that I've always found lacking in Confluence is the ability to simply create a new Office document directly from within a confluence page.
At present, the only option is to create a new Word, Excel, or PowerPoint file directly within the office application and save it locally to your disk before having to then navigate around and drag it onto a confluence page. But what if users could simply choose a attachment/document template?
I'd like to see the attachments macro and backend enhanced to support predefined document templates...not just specific to Microsoft documents though.

The system administrator/space administrator should have the ability to upload empty or templated files into the Admin section of Confluence, with assigned document type name and icon.
Then, when a user views the attachments macro within a page, the user would be presented with the option to either Upload/Drag an attachment (existing) or Create a new document from the below attachment templates. Please refer to the attached mockup image.
When the user clicks a template icon, they would be prompted for an initial 'filename' (required) and optional Comment and Labels before being presented with a refreshed screen containing the empty attachment. At this point the user would edit the document via their normal means...either Edit in Office, GoEdit or 'Unlock'. If 'Edit in Office' is the standard practise for the organisation, perhaps the named blank document would automatically open as though clicking 'Edit in Office' and lock it for exclusive use.
Implementing such a feature would not only assist with user acceptance and uptake of Confluence but also save time for those staff who already regularly use it.

Suggested features to include:
* System Admin - Ability for the system admin to upload template files, icon and name
* System Admin - Ability to set 'Global attachment templates'
* System Admin - Ability for Space Admins to set use of 'Global attachment templates' or attachment templates specific to their team..i.e PDF, JPG etc
* system Admin - Ability to set global method of editing Office documents...such as 'Edit in Office'. This option then identifies if the newly created file with automatically open for use once created.
* Attachment Macro - When viewed inside a page, macro allows the user to click the attachment template to use. User is prompted for a required Filename. Comments and Labels or optional
* Attachment Macro Options - Show/Hide  'Attachment Templates'
* Add dropdown menu - within this menu, provide link to 'Add new attachment from Template' which executes the Attachments macro.

That's about it really... I hope there's enough detail to understand where I'm going with this. This enhancement should not cost more to your customers and should be covered within a maintenance release.
Feel free to email for any further clarification.
thanks
Tim

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32348].
  {panel}

Provide some common* JIRA queries in the JIRA Issues Macro.  

Eg I want to link to the issues fixed in a particular release of a particular project (see CONF-32347 for a suggestion that would complement or obviate this feature request).

Selecting this option in the macro would reveal a field for Project & another for Fix Version.  The macro would be rendered as text "Issues fixed in XYZ 1.2.3" linking to the search page.

Other use-cases might be for all unresolved issues, all blockers, etc.

*One person's "common" is another's "rare", though.
fields.summary: Provide some common JIRA queries in JIRA Issues Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32347].
  {panel}

In *Confluence Admin > Configuration > Shortcut Links* provide an option where Expanded Value can be a valid JQL query.  

This would be executed against the associated JIRA instance (for OnDemand customers) or an arbitrary JIRA instance (for standalone customers - might need a separate field for this).

Alternatively:
* Document how to enter complex urls (ie those containing {{+}} & {{%}}-encodings, as well as the {{%s}} placeholder) in Expanded Value
* Be more intelligent about handling such urls
* Consider whether {{%}} isn't a good choice of placeholder for substitution into a url
fields.summary: Make it easier to create a Shortcut Link to a JQL query

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32345].
  {panel}

In Confluence, Space Tools > Integrations, you are able to add a link to a Trusted Application's (JIRA) specific project. However, there doesn't seem to be any reason to for this feature as the additional integration features that this enabled (auto-linking) have since be deprecated from APPLINKS and were decided [not to fix|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23693?focusedCommentId=276546&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-276546] as the feature is provided by the jira issues macro.

The [applinks documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS030/Application+Links+Documentation] clearly states that textual linking would be available once the space integration is created between applications.

There is also much confusion in the community about what the Integrations feature is supposed to do:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/131303/difference-between-application-link-and-linked-space-between-jira-and-confluence

As there is no documentation referencing the features available from creating an Integration link in Confluence to another application, I suggest that we remove the feature or update the documentation so that the added feature set is clear to customers:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Creating+Links+Between+Projects

I've added some screenshots of the successful connection to JIRA with some text to show the lack of auto-linking and successful JIRA issues macro rendering.
fields.summary: Space Integration feature deprecation

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32298].
  {panel}

When viewing the "Work" screen on a sprint board, I can click on a task to open it's details on the right in a sort of detail view. However, that detail screen is very skinny and I would like the ability to make it wider since I have wide monitors. That functionality exists on the "Plan" view of the sprint, but I would also like that functionality on the "Work" view as well.

My Reasoning:
As a team member responsible for completing tasks in the sprint, it would be helpful for me to see the big picture that I get from the "Work" screen during the sprint while being able to quickly view the detail of each task without that detail being cramped way over on the side with lots of scrolling.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Resizeable task detail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32259].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence site-import is only available within OnDemand if the OnDemand instance is Confluence only.  This limitation is highlighted here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+a+Confluence+Site

An improvement would be to allow Confluence site-import for OnDemand instances where JIRA or other services are running

A limitation of the site-import is the removal of existing users on performing the import.  The process would need to be robust enough to handle and retain existing user data.

The benefit of implementing the improvement would allow users to migrate from 
A) JIRA OnDemand<->Confluence installed config to
B) JIRA OnDemand & Confluence OnDemand (retaining previous issue links)

Affect:
*Confluence version: 5.4-OD-4*
fields.summary: Confluence site import for OnDemand instance with multiple services

Hi everyone,
Thanks for your feedback on this issue. We acknowledge that administrators need a way to performance test Confluence releases prior to upgrade and will be exploring new ways to help you do that. We update this issue status once we have made further progress.

Bill Arconati,
Confluence PM

This is simply a request to update to the text regarding the use of the macro "Background Color."
The description currently does not explain how to properly use "hex values" as a color choice.  In my world, hex means 0xFFFFFF.  Apparently you need to use #FFFFFF instead.  A simple modification to the description to include an example hex value would be appreciated.

Please update the description to include the proper hex syntax as shown below.    ( _changes_read_like_this_ ):

Sets the background color for a block of content. Colour names or hex values _(_example:_#A0A0A0_for_grey_)_ can be used. 

LevelOfEffort: Trivial
LevelOfTesting: Trivial
fields.summary: Update description regarding "background color" macro to improve ease of use

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32224].
  {panel}

We have multiple Projects in our Project Space.

We want to allow the Project Page to have lists of Meeting or Decision pages related to that Project.

Currently this only seems to be possible by having all staff enter an extra project label to every single page. This is proving impossible in the real world.

Could we add a Checkbox on the Page Properties Report macro that restricts the results to only include child-pages of the current page with the label?

Thankyou.
fields.summary: Allow Page Properties Report Macro to filter for children of current page only
